p: Giant hogweed produces a large amount of chemical compounds. The novel weapon hypothesis can be helpful to understand the success of the giant hogweed in Europe [ 14]. Few studies were performed to evaluate impact of water extracts and root exudates of giant hogweed to native species [ 6, 15, 16, 17]. Furanocoumarins produced by giant hogweed have negative effects on the germination of native species affected by soil or soil water extracts [ 14]. The water extract from the aboveground parts of giant hogweed were tested as inhibitors of the seed germination [ 2] and seedling growth (shoot length, root length) [ 6].
